meanings.definition: A person or thing that startles.
meanings.sent1: The startler hid behind the door and jumped out to surprise his friend.
meanings.sent2: The sudden loud noise was a startler for the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent3: The startler wore a funny mask to scare his friends on Halloween.
meanings.sent4: Her unexpected appearance at the party was a startler to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The horror movie had many startlers that made the audience jump.

meanings.definition: To cause a person or animal to feel sudden shock or alarm.
meanings.sent1: The loud bang would startler the little puppy.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected thunderstorm startlered the children playing outside.
meanings.sent3: The prankster loved to startler his friends by hiding behind corners.
meanings.sent4: The news of the upcoming test startlered the students.
meanings.sent5: The sudden burst of fireworks startlered the birds in the trees.

meanings.sent1: The cat would startler when someone opened the door quickly.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected noise made her startler and drop the glass.
meanings.sent3: The startler of a squirrel made the dog chase after it.
meanings.sent4: The startler of a gust of wind caused the leaves to swirl around.
meanings.sent5: The startler of a sudden clap of thunder made her jump in surprise.
